RumorFact.Text: Protea's Vessel is called The Astrophytum. It is currently miniaturizing into a black hole.

ExploreFact.Text: This is Protea's Vessel. It is currently miniaturizing into a black hole.

RumorFact.Text: There is a campsite at the south pole of The Astrophytum.

ExploreFact.Text: I found a recording of a Nomai named Deutzia introducing Protea to The Astrophytum.
The Astrophytum is an older Nomai Vessel with modern technology added by Deutzia.
A Nomai named Protea normaly accesses the Towers Controller by throwing an object at a loose tile just before the Interior Entrance.
The Warp Stabilizer requires 50 "NEU".
All Photovoltaic Trees on The Astrophytum were at full size, yet are only producing 20 "NEU".
Protea's clan was in a rush to escape a dying star and warped without activating the Warp Stabilizer.
I primed the Warp Stabilizer by attempting to activate it 4 times.
The Astrophytum grew in size a while after I primed the Warp Stabilizer.
Protea's clan's Exploration Logs were put on a computer in the Library to preserve them after a star's death.
A Nomai pointed out the logs would not be able to be accessed in the event of damage until The Astrophytum is fixed.

RumorFact.Text: A broken warp core and an oversized white hole core were put in a storage area above the Library.

ExploreFact.Text: There is a broken warp core and an oversized white hole core on a table here.
The white hole core does not change size with the planet when I hold it.

RumorFact.Text: Access to the Towers Controller is blocked by a loose panel.

ExploreFact.Text: I entered the room with the Towers Controller by launching my scout at a loose wall panel.
Both towers must be activated within around 15 seconds of eachother to open access to the Central Core. This should require two people as The Astrophytum is too large to activate both towers in time.

RumorFact.Text: The Equitorial Towers are required to access the Central Core.

ExploreFact.Text: I entered an Equitorial Tower after opening them with the Towers Controller.

According to a Nomai recorder in the West Tower: the orb interfaces in the Equitorial Towers are blue when no towers are active, yellow when only that tower is active, and geen when both towers are active.
The white hole core in The Astrophytum's Central Core requires replacement.
The warp cores connecting The Astrophytum and Hidden Light were repurposed for The Astrophytum's Central Core.

RumorFact.Text: The Central Core was damaged durring The Astrophytum's warp to this system.
The Equitorial Towers must be activated to access the Central Core.
The entrance to the Central Core is at The Astrophytum's north pole.

ExploreFact.Text: I entered The Astrophytum's Central Core.
I fixed The Astrophytum by replacing the white hole core.

RumorFact.Text: Protea's clan was unable to recover their exploration logs while evacuating their Vessel.
The Exploration Logs are stored on a computer in the Library.

ExploreFact.Text: "PROTEA: We have just warped to the Silverflame system! The Astrophytum is currently orbiting a gas giant we have named Golden Titan."
"BEGONIA: We just landed our shuttle on Golden Titan's moon, Bronze Observer. This moon seems to be the ideal location for studying this system!"

"BEGONIA: From our site on Bronze Observer, we have discovered a massive ocean under Golden Titan's clouds, featuring multiple islands that seem to drift with the ocean's current! I wonder if more planets like this exist."

"PROTEA: Our first landing on Golden Titan was a success! This island seems to have the same composition as Bronze Observer. Hypothesis: Bronze Observer was originaly much larger, but pieces of it broke off some time ago and landed on Golden Titan."

"PROTEA: We just recieved many reports of stars across the universe all going supernova. Using our instruments on Bronze Observer, we have learned Silverflame's star will die in just 8 days. Our clan needs to leave here as soon as possible."
